name: asherdan
text: A comment left by asherdan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Zefiel, biomusicologist, riotdejaneiro, glowpaisley, bug56, tttt2, kylemcjuicy, bug, NDCaesar, atticusonline, CanusDivinus, fattypneumonia, fmercury, regrepsnefpoh, jetsam7, ravindra108, jugglinfreak, yingkaixing, dropkickpikachu, afvbs)

name: slalvation
text:
he is five.

and travel is an enriching experience for a youngster such as himself, and he deserves it, on account of how rad he is. okay?

name: ted0phile
text:
Not to seem like I'm trying to get a comment as near as possible to the top of the page while replying to an 11 month old asset, but this was kind of a disproportionately defensive response to a comment that was basically "This series of strips is really cool. Boy! I wish I traveled more."

I guess my point is, I know it's asherdan, but don't be a dick to him if he wasn't a dick in the first place. Okay?

name: rowboat
text: Slalvation doesn't even come here anymore.

name: asherdan
text:
Tanks for your comments but it would have made me happy if someone had made the little cognitive jump in that simple little post between Philippe traveling not getting old and Philippe not getting old...and played with that theme a little.

Ah well, I prolly expect too much. Some straight lines go unanswered.

name: aperson
text: Asherdan, you continue to measure others against your own towering intellect, and make the mistake of expecting them to measure up. It's your single fault, I believe.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
You know, asherdan, I've noticed that your replies to your admirers, as they were, often mention dissatisfaction with someone "not picking up" on some semi-covert joke, message or tangent in your original post.

I'm being sincere when I ask this (I'm someone who has never lamed, chubbied, or replied to you, as far as I can remember): do you think that it's the consistent failure of the people responding, or that these type of cryptic comments aren't as clever as you might think they are?

name: asherdan
text:
Simple: both.

I think you're off on the consistent failure angle, though. Oft times people do pick up on that stuff and take off with it in their own direction. Sometimes they don't and, as said, the problem is probably a mix to various degrees of both delivery and readers.

ALSO: 'Admirers' WTF.

ALSO ALSO: What is a comment system on the foibles of cartoon characters for other than semi-covert jokes, tangents and messages to the insiders ?

name: asherdan
text:
Another example:

Sometimes they are very simple and people just fuck 'em up.

name: ted0phile
text: I'm not exactly sure why you stick around if we frustrate you so much. Why don't you just OH GOD I TRIED BEING NICE I TRIED SO HARD

name: asherdan
text:
Grrrr! You fictional people make me so angry! Grrrr!

You get my drift yet?

Tanks for the nicety attempt.

name: zem
text: 

name: mangtastic
text: Good avatar/post symmetry never gets old

name: mangtastic
text: God DAMNIT, that should be synergy.

name: rowboat
text: Kermit doesn't say swears. Bad avatar/post synergy, dude.

name: mangtastic
text: Kermit totally says swears when the cameras aren't on him.

name: deancain29
text: Damn - Philippe is only 45miles from my house!

name: soticoto
text:
And considerably less from mine (like one red bus-journey away).
... And that guy does sorta look a bit like Ricky Gervais.
........ I went to the same University as Ricky Gervais... and passed him in the street twice. He looked kinda p!ssed off the second time.

name: sp1derbaby
text: Why? What'd you do the first time?

name: hereward
text: I think Gervais is often quite unhappy.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
Amended:

Ricky Gervais in The Office is god.

name: rowboat
text: Extras is fantastic, as well.

name: fuckalgebra
text: I was tempted to give this strip a 1, simply because I hate even knowing that a Rod Stewart musical exists. I refrained.

name: wilbur
text: Man, when I first saw it I thought it was a Neil Young show... then I saw the four words that caused my head to implode, "The Rod Stewart Musical."

name: norsef
text: "by Ben Elton"

name: rowboat
text: Know your enemy.

name: carlyle
text: TONIGHT'S THE NIGHT

name: godfatherofsouls
text: I met Gin and Beer, they live among armour.

name: rowboat
text: To Americans, anyone older than Ricky Gervais may as well be Ricky Gervais' dad. That is, if they're not John Cleese.

name: rowboat
text: In regards to Britons, that is.

name: _cheesekayke
text: Either that, or that guy just looks a lot like Ricky Gervais. That was my first impression before I read the caption.

name: jeet
text: The large shoe, it will crush us all.

name: aikennubbles
text: So I'm wondering if Onstad explained the relevance of the stuffed animal, or just pressed it on people and took their pictures.  Just another crazy 'merican.

name: luckypyjamas
text:
i think this type of comic is probably very popular in britain, so they probably already knew the significance

though at this point no one knew what onstad looked like..

damn, i don't know

name: cagliostro
text:
I like the idea that the minute he steps down onto British tarmac, he's surrounded by delirious crowds waving Roast Beef banners and screaming 'ONSTAAAAD!'. Teenage girls fainting, policemen in flourescent jackets vainly trying to hold back the hordes, elderly folk having heart attacks through sheer joy.

On behalf of the British Isles, I would like to apologise sincerely for things not being so. We're trying to sort it out in time for the Olympics.

name: charchar
text: Does the Rod Stewart appear bemammaried to anyone else?

name: mattylite
text: Also it is wearing high heels. Also it is a girl. Also it is not Rod Stewart. ...but why???

name: tekende
text: This is my question as well.

name: zathyr
text:
The lady is running away from either Rod Stewart or the Musical.

Maybe the musical is about ladies running away from Rod Stewart.

name: mattylite
text: Wait, Maggie!  Come back!  Maggie I couldn't have tried any haaaaarrrdderr!

text: chubchubchubchubchubchubchubchubchub

name: saulbellow
text: I had attempted to bury that as a BBCode test when I did a post a while back using peoples' avaconatards.  But it was discovered.

text: you should've put it on the semi-secret strip.

text: Nothing stays buried long 'round here.
